issue.title: Widget HTML Online / Offline BUG
issue.body:
This BUG has been tested on the demo of live helper chat.
I discovered this bug on my website and on my LHC install then tested in the demo and confirmed the issue.

BUG description:
Set an online and and offline HTML text (Online text for the online HTML and OFFLINE text for the Offline) will be bugged if the widget status is offline then the widget is updated in the page without user refresh. When the widget is clicked it will show the online form to start a chat but the offline message instead of the online message.

Screenshot:
![immagine](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/c6fa7b2b-042b-4db1-bff9-906d77aba759)

How to reproduce:
- In the widget themes edit the default theme under the custom content tab find the field for "**Custom html above status/profile body in online mode** " and input a text **ONLINE**
- In the widget themes edit the default theme under the custom content tab find the field for "**Custom html above status/profile body in offline mode**  " and input a text **OFFLINE**

Screenshot:
![immagine](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/73146bb5-42dc-430c-8cb1-b71d05235a7c)

- Save the theme

- Now load the user page with the live chat widget, in the case of live helper chat: https://livehelperchat.com
Chat should be online and you should see correctly ONLINE HTML text. In the live helper chat you need open the pop up then open the widget to see that text because the pro active invitation override the text.

![livescreen](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/6e2bc3c5-6186-44fd-9cb2-005ac46bf6bf)

- Now you need put the department and the operator to be offline and wait the widget is converted to the offline status or you can simply refresh the page.

- Now put again the operator and department to online mode and wait the widget is refreshed without the page refresh.

Expected results:

- The status widget when switch from offline to online, when is clicked should show the start chat with the online HTML on top.

Actual results:

- The status widget when is refreshed without page refresh from offline to online still show the Offline text and never show the ONLINE Text so issues with HTML showed.

![livescreen2](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/cf7165f8-6a08-4bfc-a672-add31b3054db)

Other screen to show better the issue:

![livescreen3](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/05afea0e-8fbc-4f73-9e11-41be94b4708e)

So the widget is not correctly refreshed.

comment.body:
Just adding some details.
On my personal LHC install I set some HTML code to be showed before the chat.
**This has been setup in theme widget, Text above start chat form fields.**

![immagine](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/2d7d00ac-cc2d-4acf-b308-fc80922c481c)

The good result when the chat is online is:

![Screenshot 2023-10-19 121056](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/2925d5f4-a869-459c-a035-25dd96187c86)


**The HTML show online time and online status**.

**When the widget switch to offline a offline HTML message is correctly showed.**

![Screenshot 2023-10-19 121354](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/ed3052fe-7108-4e03-b697-b6464b315bfb)

**When the widget switch from offline to online the BUG happen:** the offline HTML is not hidden and is added to the online HTML correctly showed.

![Screenshot 2023-10-19 121731](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/5006150/cec9f3cb-e00d-4c2f-90a9-2eccbcc827df)

Note: For the online widget, for add the online chat text I use the field Text above start chat form fields in the theme widget.
I tried to remove the HTML from there and put this on the field online HTML but this is showed above the chat logo I have so its a bad visual. I hope with the fix to see just the offline HTML hidden and the Text above start chat form fields still showed when the widget is online :)

commits.message: Show departments only operator has access to
It can be only cookie as variable without any additional ones
Rest API call survey content support
Option to pass website cookies if chat and website is under same domain.

issue.title: fix username prefill when online_tacking is disabled
issue.body:
HI @remdex,
As I reported on the chat, the nickname doesn't seem to work when you start a chat with a prefill url such as https://xxx.xxx.xxx/lhc_web/chat/start/(department)/support?prefill[username]=ALAN and "Enable online site visitors tracking" is not checked in Chat configuration ~ Online tracking

This commit works for me but let me know if you disagree

Alan

comment.body:
In official demo I just enabled username field and made it invisible
![image](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/1146085/ea91df46-5cf7-4651-918b-68939d3c9548)

I have also disabled online tracking.

and passed it like
https://demo.livehelperchat.com/chat/start/(department)/1?prefill[username]=dummy

And all works :)

So you for sure missed some bits

issue.title: fix username prefill when online_tacking is disabled
issue.body:
HI @remdex,
As I reported on the chat, the nickname doesn't seem to work when you start a chat with a prefill url such as https://xxx.xxx.xxx/lhc_web/chat/start/(department)/support?prefill[username]=ALAN and "Enable online site visitors tracking" is not checked in Chat configuration ~ Online tracking

Alan

comment.body:
Seems I can't reproduce your issue. This variable is always prefilled, perhaps you are using older version. Make sure you have in start chat form settings enabled username field which is named `Name`

![image](https://github.com/LiveHelperChat/livehelperchat/assets/1146085/2aadc25f-77e3-428a-81e5-7872a18e4ef2)

You should have at-least those two checked,

 This field is visible in the page widget
 This field is invisible but prefilled data is collected
